thread.title: U.S. stocks fall at open as consumer-price report hints at rate increase
thread.title_full: U.S. stocks fall at open as consumer-price report hints at rate increase - MarketWatch

author: Mark DeCambre
title: U.S. stocks fall at open as consumer-price report hints at rate increase
text:
U.S. stocks opened lower Wednesday after a reading of consumer prices suggested that inflation might be rising at a sufficiently healthy pace to warrant a rate increase by the Federal Reserve as early at its next meeting in September. The S&P 500 SPX, -0.91% lost about 6 points, or 0.3%, to 2,088, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -0.99% lost 113 points, or 0.7%, to 17,387 while the Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, -0.86% fell 21 points, or 0.5%, to 5,034.
Read the full story: U.S. stocks sink at open after July CPI report
